data.text: Distinguished from traditional knowledge graphs (KGs), temporal knowledge graphs (TKGs) must explore and reason over temporally evolving facts adequately. However, existing TKG approaches still face two main challenges, i.e., the limited capability to model arbitrary timestamps continuously and the lack of rich inference patterns under temporal constraints. In this paper, we propose an innovative TKGE method (PTBox) via polynomial decomposition-based temporal representation and box embedding-based entity representation to tackle the above-mentioned problems. Specifically, we decompose time information by polynomials and then enhance the model's capability to represent arbitrary timestamps flexibly by incorporating the learnable temporal basis tensor. In addition, we model every entity as a hyperrectangle box and define each relation as a transformation on the head and tail entity boxes. The entity boxes can capture complex geometric structures and learn robust representations, improving the model's inductive capability for rich inference patterns. Theoretically, our PTBox can encode arbitrary time information or even unseen timestamps while capturing rich inference patterns and higher-arity relations of the knowledge base. Extensive experiments on real-world datasets demonstrate the effectiveness of our method.
data.translation: 区别于传统的知识图谱(KGs)，时间知识图(TKGs)必须充分探索和推理关于时间演化的事实。然而，现有的TKG方法仍然面临两个主要挑战，即有限的能力连续建模任意时间戳以及在时间约束下缺乏丰富的推理模式。在本文中，我们提出一种创新的TKGE方法（PTBox），通过基于多项式分解的时间表示和基于盒子嵌入的实体表示来解决上述问题。具体而言，我们通过多项式分解时间信息，然后通过合并可学习的时间基础张量，增强模型灵活地表示任意时间戳的能力。此外，我们将每个实体建模为一个超矩形盒子，并将每个关系定义为在头部和尾部实体盒子上的变换。实体盒子可以捕获复杂的几何结构并学习稳健的表示，提高模型对丰富推理模式的归纳能力。从理论上讲，我们的PTBox可以编码任意时间信息甚至未知时间戳，同时捕捉知识库的丰富推理模式和高阶关系。对真实世界数据集的大量实验证明了我们方法的有效性。

data.translation: 与传统知识图谱 (KG) 不同的是，时间知识图谱 (TKG) 必须充分探索和推理时序演化的事实。然而，现有的 TKG 方法仍然面临两个主要挑战，即持续模拟任意时间戳的能力有限，以及在时间约束下缺乏丰富的推理模式。在这篇论文中，我们通过多项式分解的时间表征和基于方框嵌入的实体表示提出一种创新的 TKGE 方法 (PTBox)，以解决上述问题。具体来说，我们通过多项式分解时间信息，然后通过集成可学习的时间基础张量，增强模型灵活表示任意时间戳的能力。此外，我们将每个实体建模为一个超矩形盒，并将每个关系定义为对头尾实体盒的转换。实体盒能够捕捉复杂的几何结构，并学习稳健的表示，从而提高模型对丰富推理模式的归纳能力。理论上，我们的 PTBox 可以编码任意的时间信息或甚至未见的时间戳，同时捕获丰富的推理模式和知识库的高阶关系。在真实世界数据集上的广泛实验证明了我们方法的有效性。

data.translation: 与传统知识图谱（KG）不同，时间知识图谱（TKG）必须能够适当地探索和理解随时间演化而变化的事实。然而，现有的TKG方法仍存在两个主要问题，即无法有效地描述任意时间点的模型能力有限，而且无法在时间框架下定义丰富的推理模式。本文提出了一种创新的TKGE方法（PTBox），它通过多项式分解的时间特征和盒状映射的对象特征来解决上述问题。该方法首先利用了学习可变的时间基本矩阵，使模型能够适当地描述任意时间点，并且还能够增强对对象的描述能力，从而提高了模型的推理能力，具体地说，可以捕捉复杂的对象结构，并且可以学习更加精确的对象表示。我们还证明了该方法在理论上可以对任意时间点进行编码，甚至可以对未知的时间点进行编码。在实际应用中，我们进行了大量实验，对我们的方法进行了证明。

data.translation: 与传统知识图谱（KGs）相区别，时间知识图谱（TKGs）必须充分探索和推理随时间演变的事实。然而，现有的TKG方法仍然面临两个主要挑战，即有限的能力连续建模任意时间戳和缺乏在时间约束下丰富的推理模式。在本文中，我们提出一种创新的TKGE方法（PTBox），通过基于多项式分解的时间表示和基于方框嵌入的实体表示来解决上述问题。具体地，我们通过多项式分解时间信息，然后通过融入可学习的时间基础张量，增强模型灵活表示任意时间戳的能力。此外，我们将每个实体建模为一个超矩形方框，并将每个关系定义为作用于头部和尾部实体方框的变换。实体方框可以捕捉复杂的几何结构并学习稳健的表示，提高模型对丰富推理模式的归纳能力。理论上，我们的PTBox可以编码任意时间信息甚至未见时间戳，同时捕捉知识库的丰富推理模式和高元关系。在实际数据集上的大量实验表明我们方法的有效性。

data.translation: 与传统知识图谱不同，时间知识图谱（TKG）需要充分探索和推理随时间演变的事实。然而，现有的TKG方法仍面临两大挑战：一是难以持续准确模拟任意时间戳，二是在时间约束下缺乏丰富的推理模式。在本论文中，我们提出了一种创新的TKGE方法（PTBox），通过多项式分解进行时间表征和基于盒模型的实体表征来解决这些问题。具体来说，我们将时间信息通过多项式进行分解，并通过整合可学习的时间基础张量，增强模型对任意时间戳的灵活表征能力。此外，我们将每个实体表示为一个超矩形盒，并定义每种关系为对头尾实体盒的转换操作。通过这种方式，实体盒不仅能捕捉复杂的几何结构，还能学习到稳健的表示，从而增强模型对丰富推理模式的归纳能力。理论上，我们的PTBox能够编码任意时间信息甚至未知时间戳，同时捕捉丰富的推理模式和更高阶的知识库关系。在多个真实世界数据集上的广泛实验已证明了我们方法的有效性。

data.text: The New York appeals court on Thursday overturned the sex crimes conviction against Harvey Weinstein, the powerful Hollywood producer whose downfall stood as a symbol of the #MeToo movement. The court ordered a new trial, stating that the use of “prior bad acts” witnesses should not have been allowed. The ruling sent shockwaves through communities of sexual assault survivors, particularly the more than 100 women who have accused Weinstein of assault and harassment. Weinstein, 72, was convicted in 2020 of first-degree criminal sexual act and third-degree rape, and he was sentenced to 23 years in prison. He has maintained his innocence and denied any nonconsensual sexual activity.
data.translation: 周四，纽约上诉法院推翻了针对好莱坞强大制片人哈维·温斯坦的性犯罪定罪，他的崛起和垮台象征了“#MeToo”运动。法院下令重新审判，指出“先前不当行为”证人不应被允许。这一裁决在性侵幸存者社区中引发了震惊，特别是有100多名指控温斯坦性侵和骚扰的女性。现年72岁的温斯坦于2020年被定罪犯有一级刑事性行为和三级强奸罪，被判处23年监禁。他坚称自己的清白，并否认进行过任何非自愿的性行为。

data.text: The New York appeals court on Thursday overturned the sex crimes conviction against Harvey Weinstein, the powerful Hollywood producer whose downfall stood as a symbol of the #MeToo movement. The court ordered a new trial, stating that the use of “prior bad acts” witnesses should not have been allowed. The ruling sent shockwaves through communities of sexual assault survivors, particularly the more than 100 women who have accused Weinstein of assault and harassment. Weinstein, 72, was convicted in 2020 of first-degree criminal sexual act and third-degree rape, and he was sentenced to 23 years in prison. He has maintained his innocence and denied any nonconsensual sexual activity.
data.translation: 纽约州上诉法院在周四驳回了哈维·韦斯坦尼（Harvey Weinstein）的性侵犯指控，这是一名拥有强大影响力的好莱坞制片人的惊人逆转。这一判决迫使法官重新审理了这起案件，并宣布“以前的不良行为证人”的使用应被禁止。这一判决在受害者群体中引发了巨大的震撼，其中包括至少100多名受害者，她们指控韦斯坦尼性侵和性骚扰。韦斯坦尼，72岁，被判有性侵犯第一级罪名和三级强奸罪，并被判处23年监禁。他依然坚称自己是无辜的，并否认非法性行为。

data.text: The latest lifestyle sneakers from Allbirds are here, and they’re so light you’ll barely feel it on your feet. The Tree Runner Go, available in men’s and women’s sizing, takes the bestselling Tree Runner shoe and smartens it up a bit with some elevated detailing. It’s made from Tencel lyocell tree fiber material, which has some sustainability credentials that come along with it, and thanks to a new textile technique, it’s up to 20 times more durable than other Allbirds shoes, making it a great go-to for everyday errands, school runs and walks around the block with Fido.

It’s made from Tencel lyocell tree fiber material, which has some sustainability credentials that come along with it, and thanks to a new textile technique, it’s up to 20 times more durable than other Allbirds shoes, making it a great go-to for everyday errands, school runs and walks around the block with Fido.
data.translation: 最新的Allbirds生活方式运动鞋已经上市，它们轻到你几乎感觉不到脚上有东西。Tree Runner Go，提供男士和女士尺码，将畅销的Tree Runner鞋款稍作提升，增加了一些精致的细节。它采用的是天丝溶胶纤维树材料，拥有一些可持续性认证，并且得益于一种新的纺织技术，其耐用性比其他Allbirds鞋款高出20倍，非常适合日常差事、送孩子上学和带着宠物狗在街区周围散步使用。

It’s made from Tencel lyocell tree fiber material, which has some sustainability credentials that come along with it, and thanks to a new textile technique, it’s up to 20 times more durable than other Allbirds shoes, making it a great go-to for everyday errands, school runs and walks around the block with Fido.

data.text: On top of the Kindle and Beats Fit Pro earbuds Grumet Segal recommended, she also called out Samsung’s The Frame TV as a favorite of hers. These sets are made to make the giant rectangular space where your television goes a bit more dynamic, as they can display works of fine art when you’re not binge-watching TV or streaming a movie. This year’s models feature improved accuracy, thanks to the folks at Pantone who are providing color validation. On top of that, you can update The Frame’s style whenever you want, thanks to magnetic bezels that come in multiple styles, including metallic and wood tones — perfect for helping the TV fit alongside Mom’s favorite works of art.
data.translation: 格鲁梅特·赛加尔 (Grumet Segal) 还推荐了几款 Kindle 和贝迪斯的 Fit Pro 耳机，她还特别提到了三星的 The Frame 电视。这款电视的目的是为了让宽大的电视背景墙变得更有活力，因为它可以在你不在家追剧或观看电影时播放艺术作品。这一年的型号更新了，因为 Pantone 公司的人员提供了色彩校正，这样你就可以随时更新 The Frame 电视的风格。此外，你可以随时更改它的风格，因为它的边框是可以拆卸的，而且有多种风格可供选择，包括金属和木质材质，这样你就可以让电视与妈妈最喜欢的艺术作品搭配。

data.text: I only tried the Arc’teryx in medium, but it didn’t matter because it fit perfectly. The Atom was slim on my torso (but not too slim) and the arms were just the right length, making it perfect for layering. In a word, it was sleek. The only caveat is that Arc’teryx revised the Atom’s fit in 2023. The medium size is unchanged, while smaller sizes got tighter and larger sizes got looser. Based on the reviews online, this ticked off a few Atom loyalists, so keep that in mind if you’re replacing an older model.
data.translation: 我只试穿了中号的Arc’teryx，但这不重要，因为它正合身。Atom在我的躯干上较窄（但并不过窄），袖长刚好，适合做内层穿搭。一句话，它看起来时尚。唯一需要注意的是Arc’teryx在2023年修改了Atom的版型。中号保持不变，但较小号变得更紧，较大号变得更宽松。根据网上评论，这让一些Atom的忠实粉丝感到不满，请记住这一点，如果你是要替换一个较旧的款式。

data.text: The earliest people who could be described as "lawyers" were probably the orators of ancient Athens. However, Athenian orators faced serious structural obstacles. First, there was a rule that individuals were supposed to plead their own cases, which was soon bypassed by the increasing tendency of individuals to ask a "friend" for assistance. However, around the middle of the fourth century, the Athenians disposed of the perfunctory request for a friend. Second, a more serious obstacle, which the Athenian orators never completely overcame, was the rule that no one could take a fee to plead the cause of another. This law was widely disregarded in practice, but was never abolished, which meant that orators could "never" present themselves as legal professionals or experts. They had to uphold the legal fiction that they were merely an ordinary citizen generously helping out a friend for free, and thus they could never organize into a real profession. If one narrows the definition of lawyers to people who could practice the legal profession openly and legally, then the first lawyers would be the orators of ancient Rome.
data.translation: 可能被描述为“律师”的最早人群可能是古代雅典的演说家。然而，雅典的演说家面临着严重的结构障碍。首先，有一个规则，即个人应该自行辩护自己的案件，但这一规则很快被个人越来越倾向于向“朋友”寻求帮助绕过了。然而，到了公元前四世纪中叶，雅典人放弃了要求找一个朋友的例行请求。其次，雅典演说家从未完全克服的更严重的障碍是，没有人可以收取费用为他人辩护的规定。这一法律在实践中被广泛忽视，但从未被废止，这意味着演说家“永远”不能将自己视为法律专业人士或专家。他们必须坚持这种法律虚构，即他们只是慷慨地帮助朋友，从来不会形成真正的职业。如果将律师的定义缩小为能够公开合法执业的人，那么最早的律师将是古罗马的演说家。

data.translation: 早期的“律师”恐怕是古希腊雅典的辩论家们，但雅典辩论家们面临着严重的结构性障碍。首先，当时有一个规定，个人必须为自己的案件自行辩护，但这一规定很快被人们忽视了。随着时间的推移，越来越多的人开始请求“朋友”的帮助，但这一规定却没有被放弃，而是在中世纪末的一个时期，雅典人彻底废除了这一规定。其次，在这个规定之外，还有一个更为严重的障碍，即无法以费用的形式为别人代为辩护。这一规定在实践中被大肆违反，但却从未被取消，这意味着辩论家们无法公开地、合法地从事法律行业，他们只能扮演着“普通公民”的角色，甚至需要帮助朋友免费为他们提供法律服务，因此他们就无法组成一个真正意义上的职业。如果把“律师”的定义扩大到包括可以以法律专业人员的身份公开从事法律行业的人，那么，第一批“律师”应该是古罗马时期的辩论家们。

data.text: The earliest people who could be described as "lawyers" were probably the orators of ancient Athens. However, Athenian orators faced serious structural obstacles. First, there was a rule that individuals were supposed to plead their own cases, which was soon bypassed by the increasing tendency of individuals to ask a "friend" for assistance. However, around the middle of the fourth century, the Athenians disposed of the perfunctory request for a friend. Second, a more serious obstacle, which the Athenian orators never completely overcame, was the rule that no one could take a fee to plead the cause of another. This law was widely disregarded in practice, but was never abolished, which meant that orators could "never" present themselves as legal professionals or experts. They had to uphold the legal fiction that they were merely an ordinary citizen generously helping out a friend for free, and thus they could never organize into a real profession. If one narrows the definition of lawyers to people who could practice the legal profession openly and legally, then the first lawyers would be the orators of ancient Rome.
data.translation: 最早可以被描述为“律师”的人可能是古希腊的演说家。然而，古希腊的演说家面临了严重的结构障碍。首先，有一条规定，个人应该自己提起诉讼，这很快被个人逐渐地请求“朋友”的帮助所旁过。然而，在第四世纪中期，希腊人废除了形式性的朋友请求。其次，更重要的障碍，希腊演说家永远没有完全克服，是规定无人可以收取费用，为他人提起诉讼。这条法律在实践中被广泛违反，但从未被废除，意味着演说家永远不能自称为法律专业人士或专家。他们必须维持法律虚构，认为他们只是自愿地帮助一个朋友，因此他们永远不能组织成真正的职业。如果将律师的定义狭隘到那些可以公开和法律上实践的人，那么第一位律师可能是古罗马的演说家。

data.text: The earliest people who could be described as "lawyers" were probably the orators of ancient Athens. However, Athenian orators faced serious structural obstacles. First, there was a rule that individuals were supposed to plead their own cases, which was soon bypassed by the increasing tendency of individuals to ask a "friend" for assistance. However, around the middle of the fourth century, the Athenians disposed of the perfunctory request for a friend. Second, a more serious obstacle, which the Athenian orators never completely overcame, was the rule that no one could take a fee to plead the cause of another. This law was widely disregarded in practice, but was never abolished, which meant that orators could "never" present themselves as legal professionals or experts. They had to uphold the legal fiction that they were merely an ordinary citizen generously helping out a friend for free, and thus they could never organize into a real profession. If one narrows the definition of lawyers to people who could practice the legal profession openly and legally, then the first lawyers would be the orators of ancient Rome.
data.translation: 最初被称为“律师”的可能是古雅典的演说家。然而，这些雅典演说家面临着严重的结构性障碍。首先，规定要求个人应亲自辩护，但随着人们越来越多地请求“朋友”帮助，这一规定很快就形同虚设。到了四世纪中叶，雅典人取消了这种寻求朋友帮助的常规做法。其次，更为严重的障碍是：禁止接受费用代他人辩护的规定。这一规则虽然常被忽视，但未曾废止，因此演说家们无法把自己定位为法律专业人士或专家。他们必须保持法律上的假象，即他们只是普通市民，无偿地帮助朋友，从而无法形成真正的职业团体。如果将律师定义为能够公开和合法地从事法律职业的人，那么最早的律师应为古罗马的演说家。

data.text: After the Tel Aviv expansion another branch was established in Haifa. Towards the end of 1932 the Haganah branch of Safed also defected and joined the Irgun, as well as many members of the Maccabi sports association. At that time the movement's underground newsletter, "Ha'Metsudah" (the Fortress) also began publication, expressing the active trend of the movement. The Irgun also increased its numbers by expanding draft regiments of Betar – groups of volunteers, committed to two years of security and pioneer activities. These regiments were based in places that from which stemmed new Irgun strongholds in the many places, including the settlements of Yesod HaMa'ala, Mishmar HaYarden, Rosh Pina, Metula and Nahariya in the north; in the center – Hadera, Binyamina, Herzliya, Netanya and Kfar Saba, and south of there – Rishon LeZion, Rehovot and Ness Ziona. Later on regiments were also active in the Old City of Jerusalem ("the Kotel Brigades") among others. Primary training centers were based in Ramat Gan, Qastina (by Kiryat Mal'akhi of today) and other places.
data.translation: 特拉维夫扩张后，海法也成立了另一分支。1932年底，梭嫩市的哈加拿分支也叛变并加入伊尔贡，还有许多麦卡比体育协会的成员。那时，运动的地下通讯《哈梅茨达》（要塞）开始发行，表达了运动的积极趋势。伊尔贡还通过扩大贝塔尔征兵团的规模增加了兵员，这些志愿者组织致力于两年的安全和先锋活动。这些团驻扎在各地，延生出了众多伊尔贡据点，包括北部的耶索德哈玛阿拉、米什马尔哈亚登、罗希皮纳、梅图拉和纳哈里亚；中部的哈代拉、比尼亚米纳、赫尔兹利亚、内坦亚和卡法萨巴，以及这些地点的南部—里雄莱锡安、雷霍沃特和内斯锡约纳。后来，类似"可太尔旅"等部队也活跃在耶路撒冷的旧城中。主要训练基地设在拉马特干、卡斯蒂纳（今日基里雅特马尔阿喀）和其他地方。

data.translation: 以台阿维夫扩大后，还在海法设立了另一个分支。1932年底，萨帕德的哈加那分支也离开了，加入了伊尔群，同时，许多马卡比运动会会员也加入了。此时，运动的秘密新闻报纸“哈’米つדה”（强holds）也开始出版，表达运动的活跃趋势。伊尔群也通过扩大贝塔的征募团队来增加人数，这些团队由承诺在安全和开拓活动中服务两年的志愿者组成。这些团队基于来自许多地方的新伊尔群基地，包括北方的Yesod HaMa'ala、Mishmar HaYarden、Rosh Pina、Metula和 Nahariya  settlements；中部的Hadera、Binyamina、Herzliya、Netanya和 Kfar Saba，以及其南方的Rishon LeZion、Rehovot和Ness Ziona。后来，还有其他地方的团队也开始活动，如老城区的墙堡团队之类。主要培训中心基于Ramat Gan、Qastina（今天的今日马拉基）以及其他地方。

data.translation: 在特拉维夫扩张后，哈伊法又新设了一个分支。到1932年底，萨菲德的哈加纳分支也叛变加入了伊尔贡，许多马卡比体育协会的成员也是如此。当时，运动的地下新闻通讯《哈梅茨达》（意为堡垒）也开始出版，表达了运动的积极趋势。伊尔贡还通过扩大贝塔尔（Betar）的征募团队——一群承诺进行两年安全和先锋活动的志愿者——来增加人数。这些团队基于一些地点，从那里衍生出伊尔贡在许多地方的新据点，包括北部的耶苏德哈玛阿拉、米什马尔哈雅尔登、罗什皮纳、梅图拉和纳哈里亚；中部的哈德拉、宾亚米纳、赫尔兹利亚、内坦亚和凯法萨巴；南部的里雄列锡安、雷霍沃特和内斯津纳。后来，旅团还在耶路撒冷老城活跃（包括“哭墙旅”等）。主要训练中心位于拉马特干、卡斯提纳（今天的基里亚特马拉奇附近）和其他地方。

data.text: After the Tel Aviv expansion another branch was established in Haifa. Towards the end of 1932 the Haganah branch of Safed also defected and joined the Irgun, as well as many members of the Maccabi sports association. At that time the movement's underground newsletter, "Ha'Metsudah" (the Fortress) also began publication, expressing the active trend of the movement. The Irgun also increased its numbers by expanding draft regiments of Betar – groups of volunteers, committed to two years of security and pioneer activities. These regiments were based in places that from which stemmed new Irgun strongholds in the many places, including the settlements of Yesod HaMa'ala, Mishmar HaYarden, Rosh Pina, Metula and Nahariya in the north; in the center – Hadera, Binyamina, Herzliya, Netanya and Kfar Saba, and south of there – Rishon LeZion, Rehovot and Ness Ziona. Later on regiments were also active in the Old City of Jerusalem ("the Kotel Brigades") among others. Primary training centers were based in Ramat Gan, Qastina (by Kiryat Mal'akhi of today) and other places.
data.translation: 在特拉维夫扩张工程完成后，哈利法再次成立了分支机构。1932年末，萨法德的哈加纳（Haganah）分支机构也开始脱离派拉蒙特（Phalermont），并加入伊尔古恩，很多莫迪纳希体育协会的成员也加入了他们。在这一时期，伊尔古恩的地下报纸《堡垒》（HaMetsudah）也开始发行，表现了该组织的活跃态度。伊尔古恩的力量也因在巴特（Betar）的志愿兵团中扩大，这些团队的成员在两年内服役，并致力于安全和前沿活动。这些团队在今天的耶索达（Yesod HaMa'ala）、马拉米（Kiryat Mal'akhi）、霍兹佩拉蒙特（Hozpe Ramat Menahem）等地设立了新的伊尔古恩据点。在中央地区，哈德耶拉（Hadera）、比那米纳（Binyamina）、霍泽利亚（Herzliya）、内那亚（Netanya）、卡法萨巴（Kfar Saba）等地设立了伊尔古恩据点；在南部，锡安（Sian）、雷沃特（Rehovot）和内西亚（Ness Ziona）等地也设立了伊尔古恩据点。此后，附属于耶路撒冷老城的（“堡垒”）也成立了伊尔古恩据点。伊尔古恩的主要训练基地则设立在拉马特恩加（Ramat Gan）、卡斯塔诺（Kastana）和耶索达（Yesod HaMa'ala）等地。

data.text: After the Tel Aviv expansion another branch was established in Haifa. Towards the end of 1932 the Haganah branch of Safed also defected and joined the Irgun, as well as many members of the Maccabi sports association. At that time the movement's underground newsletter, "Ha'Metsudah" (the Fortress) also began publication, expressing the active trend of the movement. The Irgun also increased its numbers by expanding draft regiments of Betar – groups of volunteers, committed to two years of security and pioneer activities. These regiments were based in places that from which stemmed new Irgun strongholds in the many places, including the settlements of Yesod HaMa'ala, Mishmar HaYarden, Rosh Pina, Metula and Nahariya in the north; in the center – Hadera, Binyamina, Herzliya, Netanya and Kfar Saba, and south of there – Rishon LeZion, Rehovot and Ness Ziona. Later on regiments were also active in the Old City of Jerusalem ("the Kotel Brigades") among others. Primary training centers were based in Ramat Gan, Qastina (by Kiryat Mal'akhi of today) and other places.
data.translation: 在特拉维夫扩张后，又在海法建立了一个分支机构。1932年末，赛法哈加纳的分支组织也发生了背叛，并加入了伊特兰军团，此外还有许多马卡比体育协会的成员。在那时，该组织的地下报纸《堡垒》（Ha'Metsudah）也开始出版，这报纸反映了组织的活跃势头。伊特兰军团也通过扩大招募规模，增加了来自贝塔尔（志愿者组织）的几个团队，这些团队都是以两年的安全和开拓者服务为义务的志愿者组织。这些团队在北部地区建立了新的据点，包括了扫罗坡、米沙玛亚、罗辛、梅图拉和那哈里雅的定居点，以及在北方地区的其他地方，如约旦河谷、耶索德哈马拉、纳哈里雅和锡哈里亚。伊特兰军团还在耶路撒冷的老城区（“哈特尔战团”）以及其他地方建立了新的据点。主要的训练中心位于拉马特根、卡斯提娜（今日的基里亚特马拉）以及其他地方。

data.text: After the Tel Aviv expansion another branch was established in Haifa. Towards the end of 1932 the Haganah branch of Safed also defected and joined the Irgun, as well as many members of the Maccabi sports association. At that time the movement's underground newsletter, "Ha'Metsudah" (the Fortress) also began publication, expressing the active trend of the movement. The Irgun also increased its numbers by expanding draft regiments of Betar – groups of volunteers, committed to two years of security and pioneer activities. These regiments were based in places that from which stemmed new Irgun strongholds in the many places, including the settlements of Yesod HaMa'ala, Mishmar HaYarden, Rosh Pina, Metula and Nahariya in the north; in the center – Hadera, Binyamina, Herzliya, Netanya and Kfar Saba, and south of there – Rishon LeZion, Rehovot and Ness Ziona. Later on regiments were also active in the Old City of Jerusalem ("the Kotel Brigades") among others. Primary training centers were based in Ramat Gan, Qastina (by Kiryat Mal'akhi of today) and other places.
data.translation: 特拉维夫扩张后，海法也建立了一个分支。 1932年末，沙法德的哈根纳分支背叛并加入了伊尔贡，同时还有许多马卡比体育协会会员。 在那个时候，运动的地下通讯《哈梅基达》（“堡垒”）开始出版，展现了运动的积极趋势。 伊尔贡通过扩大贝塔尔的征兵团——志愿者组织，致力于两年的安全和先驱活动，以增加自身实力。 这些团队设在许多地方，从而在许多地点建立了新的伊尔贡据点，包括北部的耶苏德哈玛阿拉、米什马哈亚登、罗什皮纳、梅图拉和纳哈利亚；中部的哈德拉、宾亚米纳、赫尔兹利亚、内坦亚和卡法萨巴，以及这些地点之南的李雄锡安、瑞霍沃特和内斯锡约纳。 后来，各地还成立了类似“西墙旅”等单位的团队。 主要训练中心设在拉马特干、卡斯蒂纳（今基里雅特马拉基等地）等地。

data.text: Dolores married Donald Fuller in 1941, with whom she had two children. At the time she met Ed Wood, she was in the process of divorcing her husband (they finally divorced in 1955). She and Wood shared an apartment together for several years. Wood biographer Rudolph Grey quotes Fuller as saying of the period before her success, He [Ed Wood] begged me to marry him. I loved him in a way, but I couldn't handle the transvestism. I'm a very normal person. It's hard for me to deviate! I wanted a man that was all man. After we broke up, he would stand outside my home in Burbank and cry. "Let me in, I love you!" What good would I have done if I had married him? We would have starved together. I bettered myself. I had to uplift myself. She has also been quoted as saying that "His dressing up didn't bother me—we all have our little queer habits" and giving Wood's drinking as the reason for their breakup.
data.translation: Dolores 1941年与Donald Fuller结婚，并与之生下两个孩子。当她遇到了Ed Wood时，她正在离婚中（最终在1955年离婚）。她和Wood共居了几年。Wood的生命记录家 Rudolph Grey引用了Fuller说，在她成功之前，Wood向她请求婚姻。我对他有一种爱，但我无法处理他的跨性别行为。我是一个很正常的人。对我来说，妄想都难以违反！我想要一个完全是男性的男人。我们分手后，他在Burbank的家门外哭泣：“让我进来，我爱你！”我们一起分手，我们会饿死。我提高了自己。我必须提高自己。她还被引用说，“他的化妆不让我困扰——我们都有自己的小怪异习惯”，并指责Wood的饮酒为分手的原因。

data.translation: 多洛雷丝于1941年与唐纳德·富勒结婚，二人育有两个孩子。在她遇见埃德·伍德时，正处于与丈夫离婚的过程中（他们最终于1955年正式离婚）。她与伍德共同在一间公寓里生活了数年。伍德的传记作者鲁道夫·格雷引用富勒的话描述她成名前的岁月：“他（埃德·伍德）恳求我与他结婚。我在某种意义上爱着他，但我无法接受他的异装癖。我是一个很普通的人，难以偏离常轨！我希望我的男人完全是男人样。我们分手后，他会站在我位于伯班克的家门外哭泣，喊道：‘让我进去，我爱你!’ 如果我真的嫁给了他，又能有何好处呢？我们只会一起挨饿。我必须自我提升，提高我的生活水平。”她还提到，“他的异装行为并未让我感到不适——我们每个人都有各自的小怪癖”，同时她认为伍德的饮酒问题是他们分手的主要原因。

data.text: Dolores married Donald Fuller in 1941, with whom she had two children. At the time she met Ed Wood, she was in the process of divorcing her husband (they finally divorced in 1955). She and Wood shared an apartment together for several years. Wood biographer Rudolph Grey quotes Fuller as saying of the period before her success, He [Ed Wood] begged me to marry him. I loved him in a way, but I couldn't handle the transvestism. I'm a very normal person. It's hard for me to deviate! I wanted a man that was all man. After we broke up, he would stand outside my home in Burbank and cry. "Let me in, I love you!" What good would I have done if I had married him? We would have starved together. I bettered myself. I had to uplift myself. She has also been quoted as saying that "His dressing up didn't bother me—we all have our little queer habits" and giving Wood's drinking as the reason for their breakup.
data.translation: 多洛雷斯与唐纳德·福勒于1941年结婚，并于同年生下两个孩子。当她遇到埃德·沃德时，她正在离婚的道路上，而她和沃德一直住在一起数年之久。沃德的传记作者罗德·格雷（Rudolph Grey）引用了福勒的话，他说道：“当他向我求婚时，我对他有感觉，但我无法忍受他的变性行为。我是一个非常正常的人，很难做出改变！我想要一个完全健康的男人作为伴侣，而不是一个变性者。直到我们分手后，他曾在我的住所布鲁克林附近的班克罗夫特（Burbank）附近，曾经在门外哭泣，并呼唤我的名字：‘让我进来，我爱你！’我担心，如果我们结婚了，我们会饿死！我改善了自己的生活，我必须要做到这一点！她也曾被引用说：“他的变性行为对我来说并不重要，我们都有自己的怪癖”，并把他过度饮酒的行为称为离婚的原因。

data.text: Two major areas of interest in the era of Large Language Models regard questions of what do LLMs know, and if and how they may be able to reason (or rather, approximately reason). Since to date these lines of work progressed largely in parallel (with notable exceptions), we are interested in investigating the intersection: probing for reasoning about the implicitly-held knowledge. Suspecting the performance to be lacking in this area, we use a very simple set-up of comparisons between cardinalities associated with elements of various subjects (e.g. the number of legs a bird has versus the number of wheels on a tricycle). We empirically demonstrate that although LLMs make steady progress in knowledge acquisition and (pseudo)reasoning with each new GPT release, their capabilities are limited to statistical inference only. It is difficult to argue that pure statistical learning can cope with the combinatorial explosion inherent in many commonsense reasoning tasks, especially once arithmetical notions are involved. Further, we argue that bigger is not always better and chasing purely statistical improvements is flawed at the core, since it only exacerbates the dangerous conflation of the production of correct answers with genuine reasoning ability.
data.translation: 在大型语言模型的时代，两个主要的关注领域涉及LLMs知道什么，以及它们是否能够以及如何进行推理（或者更确切地说，是近似推理）。由于到目前为止，这些工作线大多是并行发展的（尽管有一些显著的例外），我们对探索这些交叉点感兴趣：探测关于隐含知识的推理。我们怀疑在这一领域的表现可能不足，所以采用了一个非常简单的设置，比较不同主题元素的基数之间的关系（例如，鸟的腿的数量与三轮车的轮子数量）。我们通过实验证明，尽管在每一个新的GPT版本发布时，LLMs在知识获取和（伪）推理方面确实取得了稳步进展，但它们的能力仅限于统计推理。很难说纯粹的统计学习能够应对许多常识推理任务中固有的组合爆炸，尤其是当涉及到算术概念时。此外，我们认为更大并非总是更好，追求纯粹的统计改进在核心上是有缺陷的，因为它只会加剧将正确答案的产生与真正的推理能力混为一谈的危险。

Since to date these lines of work progressed largely in parallel (with notable exceptions), we are interested in investigating the intersection: probing for reasoning about the implicitly-held knowledge. Suspecting the performance to be lacking in this area, we use a very simple set-up of comparisons between cardinalities associated with elements of various subjects (e.g. the number of legs a bird has versus the number of wheels on a tricycle). We empirically demonstrate that although LLMs make steady progress in knowledge acquisition and (pseudo)reasoning with each new GPT release, their capabilities are limited to statistical inference only. It is difficult to argue that pure statistical learning can cope with the combinatorial explosion inherent in many commonsense reasoning tasks, especially once arithmetical notions are involved. Further, we argue that bigger is not always better and chasing purely statistical improvements is flawed at the core, since it only exacerbates the dangerous conflation of the production of correct answers with genuine reasoning ability.
data.translation: 大语言模型时代的两大关注点是什么知识 LLMs 拥有，以及它们是否能够（或者接近地）推理。由于到目前为止这些工作大多数是并行进行的（有一些明显的例外），我们对其交叉部分感兴趣，探索探测隐式知识的方法。我们怀疑在这个方面的表现可能不佳，因此我们使用非常简单的比较设置，比较各种主题元素之间的卡尔数（例如，鸟有多少腿与三轮车有多少轮）。我们实验证明，尽管 LLMs 在每个新 GPT 发布时都有稳定的知识学习和（伪）推理进展，但它们的能力只限于统计推断。很难说，纯粹的统计学习可以应对许多常识推理任务的组合爆炸问题，尤其是当数学概念涉入时。进一步，我们认为大不一定是好的，追求纯粹的统计改善是有缺陷的，因为这只会加剧正确答案的生产与真正推理能力的混淆。

data.text: Two major areas of interest in the era of Large Language Models regard questions of what do LLMs know, and if and how they may be able to reason (or rather, approximately reason). Since to date these lines of work progressed largely in parallel (with notable exceptions), we are interested in investigating the intersection: probing for reasoning about the implicitly-held knowledge. Suspecting the performance to be lacking in this area, we use a very simple set-up of comparisons between cardinalities associated with elements of various subjects (e.g. the number of legs a bird has versus the number of wheels on a tricycle). We empirically demonstrate that although LLMs make steady progress in knowledge acquisition and (pseudo)reasoning with each new GPT release, their capabilities are limited to statistical inference only. It is difficult to argue that pure statistical learning can cope with the combinatorial explosion inherent in many commonsense reasoning tasks, especially once arithmetical notions are involved. Further, we argue that bigger is not always better and chasing purely statistical improvements is flawed at the core, since it only exacerbates the dangerous conflation of the production of correct answers with genuine reasoning ability.
data.translation: 在大语言模型时代两个主要的兴趣领域涉及LLMs知晓什么，以及它们是否能够进行推理（或者说，近似推理）的问题。至今这些研究方向基本上相对独立发展（当然也有显著的例外），我们对探寻交叉点感兴趣：探索关于暗含知识的推理。怀疑LLMs在这一领域表现不佳，我们采用了一个非常简单的比较设置，比较不同主题元素的基数（例如，鸟有几条腿与三轮车上的车轮数）。我们经验性地证明，尽管LLMs在每一个新的GPT发布中在知识获取和（伪）推理方面取得稳定进展，但它们的能力仅限于统计推断。很难认为纯粹的统计学习可以应对许多常识推理任务固有的组合爆炸，特别是一旦牵涉到算术概念。此外，我们认为，更大并不总是更好，追求纯粹的统计改进在根本上是有缺陷的，因为它只会加剧正确答案的生成与真正推理能力的危险混淆。

value.text: ，而且它还会误导我们认为统计学习方法就足够了。我们认为，大型语言模型的研究方向应该不仅仅是大型模型本身，而是需要探讨大型语言模型的推理能力，以及大型语言模型如何用于实际应用。

data.text: Two major areas of interest in the era of Large Language Models regard questions of what do LLMs know, and if and how they may be able to reason (or rather, approximately reason). Since to date these lines of work progressed largely in parallel (with notable exceptions), we are interested in investigating the intersection: probing for reasoning about the implicitly-held knowledge. Suspecting the performance to be lacking in this area, we use a very simple set-up of comparisons between cardinalities associated with elements of various subjects (e.g. the number of legs a bird has versus the number of wheels on a tricycle). We empirically demonstrate that although LLMs make steady progress in knowledge acquisition and (pseudo)reasoning with each new GPT release, their capabilities are limited to statistical inference only. It is difficult to argue that pure statistical learning can cope with the combinatorial explosion inherent in many commonsense reasoning tasks, especially once arithmetical notions are involved. Further, we argue that bigger is not always better and chasing purely statistical improvements is flawed at the core, since it only exacerbates the dangerous conflation of the production of correct answers with genuine reasoning ability.
data.translation: 大语言模型时代有两个重要研究方向，一个是关于LLM（大语言模型）的知识表示能力，另一个是关于LLM（大语言模型）的推理能力，这两者都是较为复杂的问题。截至目前，这两个研究领域的发展主要是并行进行的（具有重要例外），我们感兴趣的是探讨这两个研究领域的交叉点：即探讨LLM（大语言模型）对隐含知识的推理能力。我们认为，LLM（大语言模型）的推理能力还很差，因此，我们采用了一种非常简单的对比方法，把各个领域的元素进行对比（例如，鸟类的脚趾数与三轮车的轮子数）。我们通过实验证明，在LLM（大语言模型）不断推出新版本的情况下，它们的知识获取能力和推理能力都有了很大的进步，但是它们只能做到统计推断，并不能真正地理解问题。在解决许多常识推理问题时，统计推断显然无法应对极大的组合推理问题，而且它还会误导我们认为统计学习方法就足够了。我们认为，大型语言模型的研究方向应该不仅仅是大型模型本身，而是需要探讨大型语言模型的推理能力，以及大型语言模型如何用于实际应用。

data.text: Two major areas of interest in the era of Large Language Models regard questions of what do LLMs know, and if and how they may be able to reason (or rather, approximately reason). data.translation: 在大型语言模型时代，两大主要研究领域是关于大型语言模型所知道的问题以及它们是否可以进行逻辑推理（或者说，大体上进行逻辑推理）的问题。虽然这两个研究领域的进展大多是同步的（但有少数例外），但我们仍然很感兴趣地研究这两个领域的交点：我们试图探索大型语言模型在潜意识中所知道的知识，并至少暂时将其理解为逻辑推理的能力。为了证明大型语言模型在每次 GPT 版本更新后都在知识收集和（伪）逻辑推理方面有了新的进步，我们进行了一系列实验，利用对不同主题的各种元素数量的比较（例如，一只鸟的腿数量与三轮车的轮数之间的比较），证明了大型语言模型在知识收集方面的进步并不能解决所有逻辑推理问题。我们进一步证明，大型语言模型的逻辑推理能力远远不足以解决很多常见的逻辑推理问题，尤其是当数学概念被涉及时。我们进一步证明，大型语言模型的性能优化并不是一个好主意，因为它们在逻辑推理方面的表现仅仅是一种滥用，而不是真正的能力提升。

data.text: I can’t take credit for this one — my boyfriend got my mom this for Christmas. She’s constantly listening to jazz at home, but she hates what she calls the “tinny” audio quality on her laptop. This voice-control speaker obviously does much more than play music, but we helped her set up Spotify and now she can command Google to play her music whenever she wants. Design is important too, and the speaker is really sleek and just kind of disappears into the space. She keeps it in the kitchen, so I taught her how to use it as a timer or to ask it other cooking-related questions, but honestly, she just uses it to play her jazz. — Sophie Shaw, associate beauty editor
data.translation: 这个功劳不能算在我头上——是我男朋友给我妈妈买的圣诞礼物。她经常在家听爵士乐，但对笔记本电脑的“空洞”音质很反感。这款语音控制音箱显然不仅仅是播放音乐，我们帮她设置了Spotify，现在她能随时让谷歌播放自己喜欢的音乐。设计也很关键，音箱外观优雅时尚，完美融入空间。她把它放在厨房，我教她如何使用它作为计时器或询问烹饪相关问题，不过说实话，她最多就是用它来播放爵士音乐。 — 索菲·肖，副美容编辑

data.text: At the time, Vin Diesel was threatening to become a muscle megastar like Schwarzenegger before him. Pitch Black was his Conan the Barbarian, while Chronicles should have been his Conan the Destroyer - a proof of blockbuster value on his way to working with the best directors. Unfortunately, he then got bogged down in a billion Fast and Furious movies and the not-quite-franchise xXx, unlike Arnold who - for a while at least - managed to combine popcorn action with genuinely good movies (Terminator, Predator, Total Recall, etc.). Nevertheless, the character of Riddick continues to maintain a fan base and a significant presence in Internet memes.
data.translation: 在当时，维恩·戴维斯已经暗示着自己有可能成为像施瓦辛格一样的肌肉大师，而他的《黑暗印记》则是他的《刀锋战士》，而《尘封岁月》应该是他的《毁灭者》——这是他走向大导演之路的证明。不幸的是，他在之后却陷入了无尽的《速度与激情》系列电影之中，并在不同程度上受到了《xXx》这个不算是真正的系列的影响。虽然艾尔文·施瓦辛格曾一度在热门的动作片中扮演过不错的角色（《终结者》、《骷髅熊》、《全面回忆》等），但维恩·戴维斯的《黑暗印记》系列电影却一直保持着一定的粉丝群和在互联网上的影响力。

data.translation: 当时，维恩·迪塞尔 (Vin Diesel) 正威胁要成为类似施瓦辛格 (Schwarzenegger) 的肌肉巨星。《暗夜行者》是他的《康托曼》，而《剑之传奇》则应该是他的《康托曼大战巨兽》——这都是具有票房吸引力的作品，而他正在朝着与最优秀的导演合作的方向前进。可惜，他随后被《速度与激情》系列的无数部分牵绊，并没有把握住 xXx 系列的机会，与阿诺德·施瓦辛格相比，他的演艺生涯似乎没有那么顺利。不过，《暗夜行者》系列的主角莱德克 (Riddick) 依然吸引了一大批粉丝，而且他的形象在网络上也一直很受欢迎，经常被用于网络笑话中。

data.text: Total daily cups is shown on the bag by age and weight. Your puppy should be fed four times a day (divide total daily cups by 4). Do not feed between meals; pick up the bowl after about 20 minutes. Of course, total daily cups will increase with age and weight. Your puppy could probably go to three times a day (divide total daily cups by 3) by 4–5 months, and twice a day (divide total daily cups by 2) around 9 months. Stay on twice a day. Are you feeding the right amount for YOUR adult dog? If you can SEE his ribs, feed more. If you can’t FEEL his ribs, feed less. All of the above is just my plan. Best of luck.
data.translation: 每天应喂狗狗四次（将每天总量的量分成4份）。不要在餐点之间喂食，大约20分钟后收起碗。当然，随着年龄和体重的增长，每天总量会增加。您的小狗可能在4至5个月大时可以改成每天三次（将每天总量的量分成3份），约9个月时可以改成每天两次（将每天总量的量分成2份）。坚持每天两次。您是否为成犬喂食了正确的量？如果您看得见他的肋骨，请多喂一些。如果摸不到他的肋骨，请少喂一些。以上仅为建议，祝您好运。

data.text: However, if I notice that the rest of their party is halfway done with their meals, while they’re moving the food around the plate? Or if too much time has passed, & their food could be getting cold? It raises red flags to a waitress. So, if I notice someone has barely touched their food? I believe it proper server etiquette to ask how their food is. It’s possible that they’re unsatisfied for a number of reasons. And if they’re unsatisfied, then it’s part of my job to fix this. Of course, sometimes they’re just taking their time, or not as hungry, or already full. But I need to check, because sometimes an unsatisfied customer won’t complain unless asked.

value.text: 新公司和产品的诞生
非竞争性条款的全面授权

data.text: A torrent of research over the past decade has shed light on just that. Here’s what economists found: Noncompetes thwart innovation and entrepreneurship, preventing the creation of new firms. A worker with a great idea for a new company or product can’t just leave to start their own business. One study found that in states where noncompetes are fully allowed, fewer patents are issued. Another found that employers don’t even value noncompetes that much: Washington state businesses were not willing to raise workers’ pay even by a few thousand dollars to be able to impose noncompetes on them. (And there are far less restrictive ways for businesses to protect their trade secrets.)
data.translation: 过去十年间，一系列研究揭示了这一点。经济学家们发现，非竞争性条款（Noncompetes）阻碍了创新和创业，因为它们阻碍了新公司和产品的诞生。一位工作人员有一个好的创业想法，但是他们却无法离开原公司创办自己的公司，因为他们所在的州允许非竞争性条款的全面授权。另一项研究则发现，在允许非竞争性条款的州，企业不愿意为员工增加工资几千美元，以便授权他们签署非竞争性条款。（事实上，企业有许多更有效的方法来保护商业机密。）

data.text: A torrent of research over the past decade has shed light on just that. A worker with a great idea for a new company or product can’t just leave to start their own business. One study found that in states where noncompetes are fully allowed, fewer patents are issued. Another found that employers don’t even value noncompetes that much: Washington state businesses were not willing to raise workers’ pay even by a few thousand dollars to be able to impose noncompetes on them. (And there are far less restrictive ways for businesses to protect their trade secrets.)
data.translation: 过去十年的研究成果揭示了这一点：非竞争性规定阻碍了创新和创业活动的发展，阻止了新企业的成立。一名想要创建新公司或新产品的工人不能随意辞职，而是必须履行非竞争性规定。一项研究发现，在允许非竞争性规定的州，授予专利的数量较少。另一项研究发现，企业对于要求员工签署非竞争性规定的要求并不强烈，在华盛顿州，企业不愿意为了能够要求员工签署这样的规定而给予他们任何增加，甚至是几千美元的工资增长。（而且，很多情况下，企业都可以通过其他方式保护自己的商业秘密。）

一个巨大的失败者

data.text: Selznick sold half of Kelly's contract to Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer for his first motion picture: "For Me and My Gal" (1942) starring Judy Garland. Kelly said he was "appalled at the sight of myself blown up 20 times. I had an awful feeling that I was a tremendous flop." "For Me and My Gal" performed very well, and in the face of much internal resistance, Arthur Freed of MGM picked up the other half of Kelly's contract. After appearing in a B movie drama, "Pilot No. 5" (1943) and in "Christmas Holiday" (1944), he took the male lead in Cole Porter's "Du Barry Was a Lady" (1943) with Lucille Ball (in a part originally intended for Ann Sothern). His first opportunity to dance to his own choreography came in his next picture, "Thousands Cheer" (1943), in which he performed a mock-love dance with a mop. Unusually, in "Pilot No. 5", Kelly played the antagonist.
data.translation: 塞尔纳克出售了凯利的合同半份给了米高梅电影公司，为他拍摄了他的第一部电影《为我和我的女友》(1942)。这部电影由朱迪·加兰主演，讲述了一对情侣在二战时期的生活。凯利表示，他“对自己被放大20倍感到惊讶，感到自己是一个巨大的失败者。”这部电影很受欢迎，尽管在制片人阿瑟·弗雷德的领导下，米高梅公司只购买了凯利的合同半份，在他接演了《飞行员号5号》(1943)和《圣诞假期》(1944)之后，凯利在《达鲁西亚夫人是个大明星》(1943)中扮演了一个反派角色。在这部电影中，凯利首次有机会自己编舞，并在一段戏中以洗澡的方式表达了对女主角卢西亚·贝尔的爱意。这部电影的剧情很特别，凯利扮演了反派角色。在《飞行员号5号》中，他与卢西亚·贝尔一起拍摄了一段戏，表达了对她的爱意。凯利的第一次舞蹈表演是在《圣诞假期》中，他用洗澡的方式表达了对卢西亚·贝尔的爱意。这部电影的剧情很特别，凯利扮演了反派角色。在《飞行员号5号》中，他与卢西亚·贝尔一起拍摄了一段戏，表达了对她的爱意。凯利的第一次舞蹈表演是在《圣诞假期》中，他用洗澡的方式表达了对卢西亚·贝尔的爱意。这部电影的剧情很特别，凯利扮演了反派角色。在《飞行员号5号》中，他与卢西亚·贝尔一起拍摄了一段戏，表达了对她的爱意。凯利的第一次舞蹈表演是在《圣诞假期》中，他用洗澡的方式表达了对卢西亚·贝尔的爱意。这部电影的剧情很特别，凯利扮演了反派角色。在《飞行员号5号》中，他与卢西亚·贝尔一起拍摄了一段戏，表达了对她的爱意。凯利的第一次舞蹈表演是在《圣诞假期》中，他用洗澡的方式表达了对卢西亚·贝尔的爱意。这部电影的剧情��

data.translation: 塞尔兹尼克将凯利合同的一半卖给了米高梅，用于其首部电影《为我和我的姑娘》（1942年），由朱迪·嘉兰主演。凯利曾表达：“看到自己被放大二十倍时，我感到震惊，觉得自己彻底失败了。”尽管如此，《为我和我的姑娘》获得了极佳的反响，在许多内部反对声中，米高梅的亚瑟·弗里德接手了凯利合同的另一半。凯利先后出演了B级剧情片《飞行员5号》（1943年）和《圣诞假日》（1944年），随后在科尔·波特的《杜巴里夫人》（1943年）中与露西尔·鲍尔（最初的角色考虑人选是安·索瑟恩）共同担纲主角。他第一次有机会展示自己编排的舞蹈是在随后的电影《万千欢呼》（1943年）中，他在该片里与一把拖把共舞，进行了一场模拟恋爱的舞蹈。在《飞行员5号》中，凯利不同寻常地扮演了一个反派角色。

data.translation: 赛伦斯尼克为他的首部电影《我的女人与我》（1942）把金·凯利的合同卖给了派拉蒙公司，凯利对此感到恐惧：“我看到自己的巨大幻影时感到惊恐，感觉自己是一部灾难片的主角。”电影很成功，而且在充满激烈抵触的情况下，派拉蒙公司的弗里德总监选择了另一半的合同。凯利接着出演了《飞行员5号》（1943）和《圣诞节假期》（1944）这两部B级电影，然后在《雷普顿夫人》（1943）中扮演了克劳德·波尔特的作品《普雷尔夫人》（Du Barry Was a Lady）的男主角，与露西尔·贝尔（原本是安妮·索伦的角色）搭档。这部电影是他第一次执导自己编排的舞蹈，他在《万人欢呼》（1943）中表演了一段模仿爱情的戏码，他在剧中扮演的是一位捣蛋鬼。在《飞行员5号》中，凯利扮演了一个反派角色。

data.text: This bikini is a great balance between style, functionality, coverage and a little sexiness. The fabric is double-layered, which means no sheerness and some added support, which I love. The one-shoulder cut is super cute, along with the side tie detail. The bottoms have a flattering high-waist cut but are a little cheeky, too. One thing to note — the bottoms hit below the belly button (which is accurate to the product pictures), so they won’t fit exactly at the waistline, if that’s what you’re looking for. Also, the top runs a little tight, so those with a larger cup size may want to size up. — Sophie Shaw, associate fashion and beauty editor
data.translation: 这款泳衣的设计非常完美，它不仅拥有时尚、功能性和覆盖面积，还带有一点儿暗示性。这款泳衣的面料是双层的，没有透明感，而且有一些辅助支撑，我非常喜欢这种设计。背心的设计很可爱，而且它的肩部设计也很有特色，而它的底部则采用了腰带的设计，腰带很有魅力，而且腰部的剪裁很有设计感，同时也很有吸引力。值得注意的是，泳裤的设计是高腰式的，但是它的腰部有一点儿宽松，因此如果你希望腰部贴身，那么可能需要考虑购买一个大号。而且，背心的设计偏紧，如果你的乳沟很大，那么建议你考虑购买一个大号。——Sophie Shaw，时尚和美容编辑

data.text: Collaborative robots must effectively communicate their internal state to humans to enable a smooth interaction. Nonverbal communication is widely used to communicate information during human-robot interaction, however, such methods may also be misunderstood, leading to communication errors. In this work, we explore modulating the acoustic parameter values (pitch bend, beats per minute, beats per loop) of nonverbal auditory expressions to convey functional robot states (accomplished, progressing, stuck). We propose a reinforcement learning (RL) algorithm based on noisy human feedback to produce accurately interpreted nonverbal auditory expressions. The proposed approach was evaluated through a user study with 24 participants. The results demonstrate that: 1. Our proposed RL-based approach is able to learn suitable acoustic parameter values which improve the users' ability to correctly identify the state of the robot. 2. Algorithm initialization informed by previous user data can be used to significantly speed up the learning process. 3. The method used for algorithm initialization strongly influences whether participants converge to similar sounds for each robot state. 4. Modulation of pitch bend has the largest influence on user association between sounds and robotic states.
data.translation: 合作机器人必须有效地向人类表达内部状态，以实现畅顺的互动。非语言通信在人类机器人互动中广泛使用，但是这些方法也可能被误解，导致沟通错误。在本工作中，我们探索通过调整非语言听觉表达（音高偏移、每分钟拍子数、每循环拍子数）来传递机器人功能状态（完成、进行中、困难）。我们提出基于噪声人类反馈的强化学习（RL）算法，以生成准确解释的非语言听觉表达。我们在24位参与者参与的用户研究中评估了该方法。结果表明：1. 我们提出的RL基础算法能够学习适合用户正确识别机器人状态的音高参数值。2. 使用之前用户数据进行算法初始化可以用来明显加快学习过程。3. 算法初始化方法对参与者是否收敛到每个机器人状态相似的声音有很大影响。4. 音高偏移对用户对声音和机器人状态的关联有最大的影响。

data.translation: 协作机器人必须有效地向人类传达其内部状态，以实现平稳互动。在人机交互过程中，非言语交流被广泛运用来传递信息，然而，这种方法有可能被误解，导致沟通错误。在这项工作中，我们探讨了调节非言语音频表达的声学参数值（音高弯曲、每分钟拍数、每圈拍数）来传达功能性机器人状态（已完成、正在进行、堵塞）的方法。我们提出了一种基于嘈杂人类反馈的强化学习（RL）算法，以产生准确解释的非言语音频表达。通过与24名参与者进行的用户研究评估了所提出的方法。结果表明：1. 我们提出的基于RL的方法能够学习合适的声学参数值，从而改善用户正确识别机器人状态的能力。2. 利用先前用户数据初始化算法可以显着加快学习过程。3. 用于算法初始化的方法强烈影响参与者是否收敛于相似的声音以表示每个机器人状态。4. 音高弯曲的调节对用户将声音与机器人状态关联起来具有最大影响。

data.text: Collaborative robots must effectively communicate their internal state to humans to enable a smooth interaction. Nonverbal communication is widely used to communicate information during human-robot interaction, however, such methods may also be misunderstood, leading to communication errors. In this work, we explore modulating the acoustic parameter values (pitch bend, beats per minute, beats per loop) of nonverbal auditory expressions to convey functional robot states (accomplished, progressing, stuck). We propose a reinforcement learning (RL) algorithm based on noisy human feedback to produce accurately interpreted nonverbal auditory expressions. The proposed approach was evaluated through a user study with 24 participants. The results demonstrate that: 1. Our proposed RL-based approach is able to learn suitable acoustic parameter values which improve the users' ability to correctly identify the state of the robot. 2. Algorithm initialization informed by previous user data can be used to significantly speed up the learning process. 3. The method used for algorithm initialization strongly influences whether participants converge to similar sounds for each robot state. 4. Modulation of pitch bend has the largest influence on user association between sounds and robotic states.
data.translation: 协作机器人必须有效地向人类传达其内部状态，以实现顺畅互动。在人机互动过程中，非语言交流被广泛用于传递信息，然而，这种方法也可能被误解，导致沟通错误。在这项工作中，我们探讨调节非语言音频表达的声学参数值（音高弯曲、每分钟节拍、每个循环的节拍）来传达功能性机器人状态（已完成、进行中、卡住）。我们提出了一种基于嘈杂人类反馈的强化学习（RL）算法，以产生被准确解释的非语言音频表达。提出的方法通过与24名参与者进行的用户研究进行了评估。结果表明：1. 我们提出的基于RL的方法能够学习适当的声学参数值，提高用户正确识别机器人状态的能力。2. 利用以往用户数据通知的算法初始化可以显著加快学习过程。3. 用于算法初始化的方法强烈影响参与者是否会收敛到相似的声音以表示每种机器人状态。4. 音高弯曲的调制对用户将声音与机器人状态联系起来具有最大影响。

data.translation: 协作机器人必须有效地向人类传递其内部状态，以确保互动顺畅。在人机交互中，非语言沟通被广泛用来传达信息，然而这种方式也容易被误解，从而导致沟通错误。在本研究中，我们探讨了调整非语言听觉表达中的声学参数值（音调弯曲、每分钟节拍数、每循环节拍数）以表达机器人的运行状态（完成、进行中、卡顿）。我们提出了一种基于带噪声的人类反馈的强化学习算法，用于生成容易被准确理解的非语言听觉表达。我们通过一项涉及24名参与者的用户研究来评估这种方法。研究结果显示：1. 我们的基于RL的方法能学习到合适的声学参数值，有助于用户正确判断机器人的状态。2. 利用历史用户数据进行算法初始化可以显著加快学习速度。3. 算法初始化的方式极大影响参与者是否可针对每种机器人状态产生相似的声音响应。4. 音调弯曲的调整对于用户将声音与机器人状态关联起来的影响是最显著的。

data.text: Webshell, as the "culprit" behind numerous network attacks, is one of the research hotspots in the field of cybersecurity. However, the complexity, stealthiness, and confusing nature of webshells pose significant challenges to the corresponding detection schemes. With the rise of Artificial Intelligence (AI) technology, researchers have started to apply different intelligent algorithms and neural network architectures to the task of webshell detection. However, the related research still lacks a systematic and standardized methodological process, which is confusing and redundant. Therefore, following the development timeline, we carefully summarize the progress of relevant research in this field, dividing it into three stages: Start Stage, Initial Development Stage, and In-depth Development Stage. We further elaborate on the main characteristics and core algorithms of each stage. In addition, we analyze the pain points and challenges that still exist in this field and predict the future development trend of this field from our point of view. To the best of our knowledge, this is the first review that details the research related to AI-based webshell detection. It is also hoped that this paper can provide detailed technical information for more researchers interested in AI-based webshell detection tasks.
data.translation: Webshell作为众多网络攻击背后的“罪魁祸首”，是网络安全领域的研究热点之一。然而，Webshell的复杂性、隐蔽性和令人困惑的特性给相应的检测方案带来了重大挑战。随着人工智能（AI）技术的兴起，研究者们开始将不同的智能算法和神经网络架构应用于Webshell检测任务。尽管如此，相关研究仍然缺乏一个系统化和标准化的方法论过程，这使得研究显得混乱且冗余。因此，我们根据发展时间线，仔细总结了该领域相关研究的进展，将其分为三个阶段：起始阶段、初步发展阶段和深入发展阶段。我们进一步阐述了每个阶段的主要特征和核心算法。此外，我们分析了该领域仍然存在的痛点和挑战，并从我们的角度预测了该领域的未来发展趋势。据我们所知，这是第一篇详细介绍基于AI的Webshell检测研究的综述。我们也希望这篇论文能为更多对基于AI的Webshell检测任务感兴趣的研究者提供详尽的技术信息。

data.translation: Webshell，作为众多网络攻击背后的“罪魁祸首”，是网络安全领域的研究热点之一。然而，webshell 的复杂性、隐蔽性和迷惑性给相应的检测方案带来了重大挑战。随着人工智能（AI）技术的兴起，研究人员已经开始将不同的智能算法和神经网络架构应用于 webshell 检测任务。然而，相关研究仍然缺乏系统化和标准化的方法论过程，令人困惑而冗余。因此，根据发展时间线，我们仔细总结了这一领域相关研究的进展，将其划分为三个阶段：初始阶段、初步发展阶段和深入发展阶段。我们进一步阐述了每个阶段的主要特点和核心算法。此外，我们分析了该领域仍然存在的痛点和挑战，并从我们的角度预测了该领域的未来发展趋势。据我们所知，这是第一篇详细介绍基于AI的 webshell 检测研究的综述。希望本文还能为更多对AI-based webshell 检测任务感兴趣的研究人员提供详细的技术信息。

data.text: Webshell, as the "culprit" behind numerous network attacks, is one of the research hotspots in the field of cybersecurity. However, the complexity, stealthiness, and confusing nature of webshells pose significant challenges to the corresponding detection schemes. With the rise of Artificial Intelligence (AI) technology, researchers have started to apply different intelligent algorithms and neural network architectures to the task of webshell detection. However, the related research still lacks a systematic and standardized methodological process, which is confusing and redundant. Therefore, following the development timeline, we carefully summarize the progress of relevant research in this field, dividing it into three stages: Start Stage, Initial Development Stage, and In-depth Development Stage. We further elaborate on the main characteristics and core algorithms of each stage. In addition, we analyze the pain points and challenges that still exist in this field and predict the future development trend of this field from our point of view. To the best of our knowledge, this is the first review that details the research related to AI-based webshell detection. It is also hoped that this paper can provide detailed technical information for more researchers interested in AI-based webshell detection tasks.
data.translation: 网络勒索软件（Webshell）作为引发了大量网络攻击的“元凶”，在网络安全领域受到了广泛关注，而且是相关研究的热点。然而，Webshell的复杂性、隐蔽性和操作性质混乱，使得其对应的检测方案存在诸多挑战。随着人工智能（AI）技术的发展，研究者开始采用智能算法和神经网络架构来检测Webshell。然而，该领域研究的相关方法论体系尚不完善，致使检测过程冗长且复杂。在此，我们按照研究发展时间线，详细回顾了Webshell检测相关领域的研究进展，将其分为了三个阶段：起步阶段、初步发展阶段和深入发展阶段。针对每个阶段，我们还对其主要特征和核心算法进行了详细描述。此外，我们还分析了该领域仍存在的问题和挑战，并对未来研究方向进行了预测。在我们所知的情况下，这是首次对基于人工智能的Webshell检测相关研究进行系统化回顾。同时，我们也希望这篇文章能为对该领域有兴趣的研究者提供有价值的技术信息。
